[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Pet Management System (PMS) defines requirements for managing household pets, including tracking pet types, names, and behaviors.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS supports household pet registration, identification, and basic interactions.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with pet management databases and household records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS allows homeowners to register, track, and interact with pets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports pet tracking devices, RFID tags, and smart home integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS secures data via TLS encryption and role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS is optimized for maintaining pet profiles and real-time interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS manages pet registration, identification, and interaction tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS is configurable for different household sizes and pet counts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS connects with veterinary databases, pet supply vendors, and tracking services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS registers pets, tracks their details, and enables interaction logging.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS is designed for homeowners, pet caretakers, and veterinary staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires pet registration and manual interaction logging.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS relies on accurate pet owner input and household data.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Pet: A domesticated animal living in a household.
Household: The living environment where pets reside.
Pet Interaction: Actions involving a pet.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage pet registration and identification (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall manage pet assignments and interactions (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to register pets, including type and name (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track pets' designated households and manage ownership details (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log pet interactions and behaviors, including noise-making activities (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer a pet management interface.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall log pet interactions within several hundred milliseconds of the event occurrence.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to many thousands interaction logs per hour without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store pet details, including type, name, and household assignment.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track pet interactions and household records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for pets and households.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with pet ownership regulations and household safety standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for pet behavior tracking and owner records.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests pet registration, tracking, and interaction logging.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and pet ownership guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Pet care regulations, household safety standards, and veterinary databases.
